t: Matthew 4
The Temptation of Jesus
Then*p Jesus was led up by the Spirit into the wilderness to be tempted by the devil.
After he had fasted forty days and forty nights, he was hungry.
Then the tempter approached him and said, “If you are the Son of God, tell these stones to become bread.”
He*p answered, “It*r is*r written:*r Man*ir must*ir not*ir live*ir on*ir bread*ir alone*ir but*ir on*ir every*ir word*ir that*ir comes*ir from*ir the*ir mouth*ir of*ir God.”*ir
Then*p the devil took him to the holy city, had him stand on the pinnacle of the temple,

and said to him, “If you are the Son of God, throw yourself down. For it is written: He*ipn will*i give*i his*i angels*i orders*i concerning*i you,*i and*ln they*i will*i support*i you*i with*i their*i hands*i so*iln that*i you*i will*i not*i strike*i your*iln foot*i against*i a*i stone.”*i
Jesus*p told him, “It*r is*r also*r written:*r Do*ir not*ir test*ir the*ir Lord*ir your*ir God.”*ir
Again,*p the devil took him to a very high mountain and showed him all the kingdoms of the world and their splendor.
And he said to him, “I will give you all these things if you will fall down and worship me.”
Then*p Jesus told him, “Go*r away,*r Satan!*r For*r it*r is*r written:*r Worship*ir the*ir Lord*ir your*ir God,*ir and*ir serve*ir only*ir him.”*ir
Then*p the devil left him, and angels came and began to serve him.
Ministry in Galilee
When*p he heard that John had been arrested, he withdrew into Galilee.
He left Nazareth and went to live in Capernaum by the sea, in the region of Zebulun and Naphtali.
This was to fulfill what was spoken through the prophet Isaiah:
Land*ipn of*i Zebulun*i and*i land*i of*i Naphtali,*i along*iln the*i road*i by*i the*i sea,*i beyond*i the*i Jordan,*i Galilee*iln of*i the*i Gentiles.*i
The*iln people*i who*i live*i in*i darkness*i have*iln seen*i a*i great*i light,*i and*iln for*i those*i living*i in*i the*i land*i of*i the*i shadow*i of*i death,*i a*iln light*i has*i dawned.*i
From*p then on Jesus began to preach, “Repent,*r because*r the*r kingdom*r of*r heaven*r has*r come*r near.”*r
The First Disciples
As*p he was walking along the Sea of Galilee, he saw two brothers, Simon (who is called Peter), and his brother Andrew. They were casting a net into the sea - for they were fishermen.
“Follow*r me,”*r he told them, “and*r I*r will*r make*r you*r fish*r for*r people.”*r
Immediately they left their nets and followed him.
Going*p on from there, he saw two other brothers, James the son of Zebedee, and his brother John. They were in a boat with Zebedee their father, preparing their nets, and he called them.
Immediately they left the boat and their father and followed him.
Teaching, Preaching, and Healing
Now*p Jesus began to go all over Galilee, teaching in their synagogues, preaching the good news of the kingdom, and healing every disease and sickness among the people.

Then the news about him spread throughout Syria. So they brought to him all those who were afflicted, those suffering from various diseases and intense pains, the demon-possessed, the epileptics, and the paralytics. And he healed them.
Large crowds followed him from Galilee, the Decapolis, Jerusalem, Judea, and beyond the Jordan.
